fields.name: Rumtek Monastery
fields.description: The Rumtek Monastery, also called the Dharmachakra Centre, is a gompa located in the Indian state of Sikkim near the capital Gangtok. It is the largest monastery in Sikkim and is the seat-in-exile of the Gyalwa Karmapa, inaugurated in 1966 by the 16th Karmapa. Built in the 1960s, it is modeled after the Karma Kagyu monastery of Tsurphu in Tibet.
fields.short_description: The largest monastery in Sikkim and seat-in-exile of the Gyalwa Karmapa
fields.cultural_significance: Home to the Golden Stupa containing relics of the 16th Karmapa. Houses precious artifacts, thangkas, and the crown and robes of the Karmapa.
fields.architectural_style: Traditional Tibetan architecture with ornate decorations and golden roof
fields.special_features: Golden Stupa, Prayer Wheels, Ancient Manuscripts, Monastic University

fields.name: Enchey Monastery
fields.description: Enchey Monastery is an important monastery of the Nyingma sect located in Gangtok, the capital city of Sikkim. Built in 1909, it was established by Lama Druptob Karpo, a famous Sikkimese mystic known for his flying powers. The monastery houses images of gods, goddesses, and other religious artifacts.
fields.short_description: Historic Nyingma monastery in Gangtok built by the famous flying lama
fields.cultural_significance: Associated with Lama Druptob Karpo, known for miraculous flying abilities. Important center for Nyingma teachings.
fields.architectural_style: Traditional Sikkimese architecture with colorful murals and intricate woodwork
fields.festivals: Chaam Dance during Pang Lhabsol, Losar, Drupka Teshi
fields.special_features: Flying Lama Legend, Sacred Masks, Traditional Chaam Dance

fields.name: Tashiding Monastery
fields.description: Tashiding Monastery is a Buddhist monastery of the Nyingma sect located on top of a hill between the Rathong and Rangeet rivers in Tashiding, Sikkim. Founded in 1641, it is one of the most sacred monasteries in Sikkim. The monastery is famous for its holy water (Bum Chu) ceremony during Losar.
fields.short_description: One of the most sacred Nyingma monasteries, famous for the holy water ceremony
fields.location_description: Tashiding, between Rathong and Rangeet rivers
fields.cultural_significance: Center of the famous Bum Chu ceremony. Believed that a sip of holy water from here can wash away sins.
fields.architectural_style: Ancient Nyingma architecture with traditional Sikkimese elements
fields.festivals: Bum Chu Festival, Losar, Saga Dawa
fields.special_features: Holy Water Ceremony, Sacred Chortens, Ancient Texts

fields.name: Pemayangtse Monastery
fields.description: Pemayangtse Monastery is a Buddhist monastery in Pemayangtse, near Pelling in the northeastern Indian state of Sikkim. Planned, designed and founded by Lama Lhatsun Chempo in 1705, it is one of the oldest and premier monasteries of Sikkim, also holding the distinction of being the head monastery of the Nyingma sect.
fields.short_description: Premier Nyingma monastery and one of the oldest in Sikkim
fields.cultural_significance: Head monastery of Nyingma sect in Sikkim. Only pure-blood Bhutias can become monks here.
fields.architectural_style: Three-storied traditional architecture with exquisite woodcarving
fields.special_features: Seven-tiered Wooden Sculpture, Ancient Murals, Monastery Museum

fields.name: Dubdi Monastery
fields.description: Dubdi Monastery, also known as Yuksom Monastery, is a Buddhist monastery of the Nyingma sect located near Yuksom in Sikkim. Built in 1701, it is the oldest monastery in Sikkim and holds great historical significance as it was here that the first Chogyal was crowned.
fields.short_description: The oldest monastery in Sikkim where the first Chogyal was crowned
fields.cultural_significance: Coronation site of first Chogyal. Oldest monastery in Sikkim with immense historical importance.
fields.architectural_style: Ancient Sikkimese architecture in pristine mountain setting
fields.special_features: Historical Coronation Site, Meditation Caves, Ancient Artifacts

fields.title: Kagyu Monlam Prayer Festival
fields.description: Annual prayer festival celebrating the Kagyu tradition with special ceremonies and teachings

fields.title: Morning Meditation Session
fields.description: Join the monks for daily morning meditation and chanting

fields.title: Bum Chu Festival
fields.description: Sacred holy water ceremony - one of the most important festivals in Sikkim

fields.title: Rumtek Main Hall
fields.description: 360° view of the magnificent main prayer hall

hotspots_data.text: The main altar with golden Buddha statue

fields.title: Enchey Courtyard
fields.description: Central courtyard where Chaam dances are performed

fields.title: 16th Karmapa's Sacred Robe
fields.description: The ceremonial robe worn by the 16th Karmapa during important ceremonies
fields.cultural_significance: Sacred relic of the 16th Karmapa, representing the spiritual lineage

fields.title: Flying Lama Manuscript
fields.description: Historical manuscript describing the miraculous powers of Lama Druptob Karpo
fields.cultural_significance: Documents the legendary flying abilities and spiritual achievements

fields.title: Bum Chu Sacred Vessel
fields.description: Ancient vessel used in the holy water ceremony
fields.cultural_significance: Central to the most sacred ceremony of Tashiding Monastery
